intro: Mohria, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Europe. The plants typically have basal leaves that are palmately lobed, and they produce showy, often yellow or orange flowers. Mohria species are perennial herbs that thrive in moist, shady environments. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental flowers and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
